page.title: 09TOURISM
page.content: Conwy has prospered from tourism resulting from its historical background.Here are the main tourist attractions:- Conwy Castle,the most popular attraction was built by EdwardI in 1283.St.Mary's Church,built by Cistercian Monks,used to be the Abbey. Telford's Suspension Bridge was,built in 1826.Aberconwy House is the oldest remaining house in Conwy(15th.C) and is characteristic of houses owned by the richer merchants of the Middle Ages.Plas Mawr is a fine Elizabethan towm house in the High St.The Smallest House in G.B.,is on the quay.Boats from the quay give a scenic trip on the river.Conwy's Information Centre is a must for the tourist,giving souvenirs,information etc. A film about the Castle is screened here. By Sukhvinder Jando.
